org.quifft.params

Class FFTParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.quifft.params.FFTParameters

  • public class FFTParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    A config object containing the parameters of a Fourier transform. These parameters are used while performing the FFT, and can be accessed as an attribute of the result.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean isLogarithmic
      If true, amplitude of frequency bins will be scaled logarithmically instead of linearly.
      boolean isNormalized
      If true, all frequency bin amplitudes will be in the range from 0.00 to 1.00, where 1.00 represents the maximum frequency amplitude amongst all amplitudes in the audio file.
      int numPoints
      Number of points in the N-point FFT.
      WindowFunction windowFunction
      Window function to be used.
      float windowOverlap
      Overlap between adjacent sampled windows.
      int windowSize
      Number of samples taken from audio waveform for use in FFT.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FFTParameters() 

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • windowSize

        public int windowSize
        Number of samples taken from audio waveform for use in FFT. If numPoints is not defined, this must be a power of 2. If numPoints is defined to be greater than window size, the signal will be padded with (numPoints - windowSize) zeroes.

      • windowFunction

        public WindowFunction windowFunction
        Window function to be used. One of: rectangular, triangular, Hanning, Hamming

      • windowOverlap

        public float windowOverlap
        Overlap between adjacent sampled windows.

      • numPoints

        public int numPoints
        Number of points in the N-point FFT. If not defined, will default to the window size. If defined, must be greater than window size and be a power of 2.

      • isLogarithmic

        public boolean isLogarithmic
        If true, amplitude of frequency bins will be scaled logarithmically instead of linearly.

      • isNormalized

        public boolean isNormalized
        If true, all frequency bin amplitudes will be in the range from 0.00 to 1.00, where 1.00 represents the maximum frequency amplitude amongst all amplitudes in the audio file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FFTParameters

        public FFTParameters()
